definitions.text: a compound made artificially by chemical reactions
not of natural origin; prepared or made artificially
involving or of the nature of synthesis (combining separate elements to form a coherent whole) as opposed to analysis; - P.S.Welch
examples: limnology is essentially a synthetic science composed of elements...that extend well beyond the limits of biology

definitions.text: systematic combining of root and modifying elements into single words
of a proposition whose truth value is determined by observation or facts
examples: `all men are arrogant' is a synthetic proposition

definitions.text: artificial as if portrayed in a film
examples: a novel with flat celluloid characters

definitions.text: not genuine or natural; - George Will
examples: counterfeit rhetoric that flourishes when passions are synthetic
